Type.Name: InvalidOperationException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit InvalidOperationException extends System.SystemException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

example.para: The following example demonstrates an error that causes a exception.

c.para: Unhandled Exception: System.InvalidOperationException: Enumeration has not started. Call MoveNext.

remarks.para: is used in cases when the failure to invoke a method is caused by reasons other than invalid arguments. For example, is thrown by:

item.para: if objects of a collection are modified after the enumerator is created.
if the resource set is closed before the method call is made.

remarks.para: To determine the precise cause of the exception, consult the exception information for the method call that throws the exception.
If the method invocation failure is due to invalid arguments, then or one of its derived classes, or , should be thrown instead.

item.para: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction throws .

remarks.para: uses the HRESULT COR_E_INVALIDOPERATION, which has the value 0x80131509.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of , see the constructors.

summary.para: The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "The requested operation cannot be performed." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of .

description.para: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new exception using the parameter. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of .

description.para: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

remarks.para: This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [<topic://cpconSerialization>].

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

Docs.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException)
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

remarks.para: An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the property. The property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of .

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
